document_data.name: Chill
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|7}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Chill''''' was a useful [[cantrip]] that apprentice [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It reduced the temperature of a quantity of liquid or solid matter.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip had a range of {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}}.The original description of this cantrip in [[Dragon magazine 59|''Dragon'' #59]] allowed for a limited effect on living things, but this was removed in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. liquids and solids that amounted to no more than {{SI|1|cu ft|L|long=yes}} in volume. The drop in temperature was about 40 ℉ ({{F2C|72}} ℃) but could not go below {{SI|32|F}}. The cantrip and temperature change were nearly instantaneous but thereafter the chilled material acted normally in the conditions surrounding it, slowly warming back up to the ambient temperature.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster gave a low whistle while making a downward-pointing gesture with the thumb.
